message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient is exhibiting signs of body dysmorphic disorder and obsessive-compulsive disorder. Cognitive-behavioral therapy is the recommended treatment for these conditions as it helps change negative thoughts and beliefs and teach healthy coping mechanisms. Hospitalization and nutritional rehabilitation are not indicated in this case. Dialectical behavioral therapy may be useful for other conditions, but is not the best choice for this patient's symptoms.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient exhibits symptoms of obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD) and body dysmorphic disorder (BDD), and cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT) is the recommended treatment for both. Dialectical behavioral therapy is more commonly used for borderline personality disorder and other mood disorders. Hospitalization and nutritional rehabilitation are not appropriate for this case.
